note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

Patient: Thomas Keller, 67-year-old male
MRN: S31640-001
Date of Procedure: 2024-01-15
Location: Horizon University Medical Center – Main OR
Attending: Dr. Laura Brennan
Assistant: Dr. Miguel Santos (IP fellow)

Pre-procedure Diagnosis:
Malignant central airway obstruction of the left mainstem bronchus from biopsy-proven squamous cell carcinoma.

Post-procedure Diagnosis:
Same.

Procedure Performed:
Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of endobronchial tumor (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia / Airway:
General anesthesia with neuromuscular blockade. Patient intubated with size 12 rigid bronchoscope; intermittent jet ventilation provided through the bronchoscope barrel. ASA class III.

Findings:
Exophytic, friable tumor arising from the medial wall of the left mainstem bronchus, extending 2.5 cm distal to the carina and causing approximately 90% luminal obstruction with distal mucus plugging. Right-sided airways patent.

Interventions:
The bevel of the rigid bronchoscope was used to perform repeated rigid coring and mechanical debulking passes through the tumor. Large pieces of tumor were removed with forceps and suction. A microdebrider was then introduced through the rigid scope to further debulk residual tumor until the lumen was widely patent. Overall, the tumor was debulked in piecemeal fashion with clear mechanical debulking and excision of obstructing tissue. No thermal ablation was used.

Hemostasis:
Mild oozing from the tumor base controlled with cold saline irrigation and topical epinephrine. No APC or laser therapy required.

Estimated Blood Loss:
25 mL.

Complications:
None immediate. No hypoxia or hemodynamic instability.

Post-procedure Airway Status:
Final left mainstem obstruction estimated at <20% with good visualization of segmental bronchi and restoration of airflow.

Disposition:
Extubated in the OR without difficulty and transferred to the ICU for overnight monitoring given high tumor burden and recent pneumonia.

Plan:
Post-procedure chest radiograph; resume systemic therapy per oncology; repeat bronchoscopy as needed for recurrent obstruction.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Malignant central airway obstruction of the left mainstem bronchus from squamous cell carcinoma.
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: CT chest with left mainstem endobronchial mass causing near-complete obstruction and distal atelectasis.
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Therapeutic bronchoscopy for malignant left mainstem obstruction.
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Endobronchial squamous cell carcinoma causing critical left mainstem obstruction.

lines.selection_reason: Documentation supports mechanical debulking/excision (rigid coring, microdebrider) without thermal ablation.

per_code.summary: Kept. Supported by explicit description of mechanical excision (rigid coring, microdebrider) and absence of thermal ablation.

global_comments: Procedure involved purely mechanical debulking; CPT 31640 is appropriate.

note_text:
BRONCHOSCOPY PROCEDURE NOTE

Patient: Maria Lopez, 58-year-old female
MRN: S31640-002
Date: 2024-02-02
Location: Lakeside Pulmonary Hospital – Bronchoscopy Suite
Attending: Dr. James Porter

Indication:
Progressive dyspnea and stridor due to benign post-intubation granulation tissue causing distal tracheal stenosis.

Pre-/Post-procedure Diagnosis:
Benign distal tracheal obstruction from post-intubation granulation tissue.

Procedure:
Flexible bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of obstructing granulation tissue (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia / Sedation:
Moderate sedation with IV midazolam and fentanyl; topical lidocaine. Native airway with oral bite block. ASA class III.

Findings:
At 2 cm above the carina there was circumferential granulation tissue and nodular scar narrowing the distal trachea to approximately 70% obstruction. No discrete mass elsewhere. Distal mainstem bronchi patent.

Interventions:
Using large alligator forceps through the flexible bronchoscope, multiple passes of mechanical debulking were performed, removing friable granulation tissue in piecemeal fashion. Snare resection was then used to excise a central fibrotic band. The stenotic ring was mechanically disrupted, and the tracheal lumen opened significantly. No balloon dilation or thermal ablation was used. The note explicitly reflects mechanical debulking and snare resection of the obstructing lesion consistent with CPT 31640.

Hemostasis / Complications:
Minor oozing controlled with cold saline; no significant bleeding. No desaturations or arrhythmias.

EBL:
Approximately 10 mL.

Disposition:
Observed for 2 hours in recovery and discharged home on inhaled corticosteroid and PPI. Follow-up bronchoscopy planned in 6–8 weeks to assess for recurrent stenosis.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Symptomatic distal tracheal obstruction from post-intubation granulation tissue.
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: CT neck/chest showing focal distal tracheal narrowing with soft tissue thickening.
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Mechanical debulking of benign distal tracheal stenosis.
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Benign post-intubation granulation tissue causing distal tracheal stenosis.

lines.selection_reason: Documentation supports mechanical debulking/excision (forceps, snare) without thermal ablation.

note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

Patient: David Nguyen, 72-year-old male
MRN: S31640-003
Date: 2024-02-23
Location: Metropolitan Cancer Center – Hybrid OR
Attending: Dr. Priyanka Rao
Assistant: Dr. Eric Williams (Fellow)

Indication:
Recurrent hemoptysis and dyspnea due to carinal mass from small cell lung cancer with near-complete obstruction of the left mainstem bronchus.

Procedure:
Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of carinal and left mainstem tumor (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia / Airway:
General anesthesia, rigid bronchoscope with jet ventilation. ASA class IV.

Findings:
Friable, circumferential tumor involving the main carina and extending into the proximal left mainstem causing approximately 85–90% obstruction with clot burden. Right mainstem lumen narrowed <20%.

Interventions:
Old clot was suctioned from the left mainstem. The rigid bronchoscope bevel was then used for aggressive rigid coring of the exophytic tumor at the carina and into the left mainstem. Multiple large tumor fragments were removed using forceps and suction. Subsequent passes with the microdebrider further debulked residual tissue. Overall, the tumor was mechanically debulked and excised in piecemeal fashion until the left mainstem lumen was restored to ~30% residual narrowing. No radiofrequency ablation, PDT, or cryotherapy was used.

Hemostasis:
Brisk bleeding during initial debulking controlled with topical epinephrine and brief balloon tamponade; no blood products required.

EBL:
Approximate blood loss 80 mL.

Complications:
Transient hypotension responsive to vasopressor bolus. No sustained hypoxia.

Disposition:
Remained intubated post-procedure and transferred to ICU for ventilatory support and close monitoring. Oncology notified for expedited systemic therapy planning.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Malignant carinal mass with left mainstem obstruction from small cell lung carcinoma.
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: CT chest with carinal mass and left mainstem occlusion with post-obstructive collapse.
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Therapeutic rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of carinal tumor.
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Extensive small cell carcinoma involving carina and left mainstem with critical airway obstruction.

note_text:
BRONCHOSCOPY PROCEDURE NOTE – MECHANICAL DEBULKING

Patient: Sarah Ibrahim, 63-year-old female
MRN: S31640-004
Date: 2024-03-05
Site: Northside Thoracic Institute – OR
Attending: Dr. Daniel Kim

Indication:
Right mainstem endobronchial metastasis from renal cell carcinoma with progressive dyspnea and wheeze.

Procedure:
Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of right mainstem tumor (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia:
General anesthesia, rigid bronchoscope, pressure-controlled ventilation. ASA class III.

Findings:
Polypoid, highly vascular tumor arising from lateral wall of the right mainstem, extending 1.5 cm distal to the carina and narrowing the lumen to approximately 80%. Distal lobar airways partially collapsed but reachable after debulking.

Intervention Details:
Initial inspection performed with flexible bronchoscope through the rigid barrel. After mapping, rigid coring of the tumor was performed with the bevel of the scope. Forceps debulking removed multiple tumor fragments. Final passes were made with a microdebrider to smooth the tumor base, achieving effective mechanical debulking and tumor resection without any ablative energy. No balloon dilation used.

Hemostasis:
Minor oozing treated with cold saline and 1:10,000 epinephrine. No APC or laser.

EBL:
30 mL.

Complications:
None. Oxygen saturation remained >94% throughout.

Post-procedure Course:
Right mainstem lumen improved to about 70–80% patency with good ventilation to all lobes. Patient extubated and taken to recovery in stable condition.

Plan:
Resume systemic therapy; repeat bronchoscopy if symptoms recur.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Symptomatic right mainstem obstruction from metastatic renal cell carcinoma.
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: CT chest showing right mainstem endobronchial lesion with partial right lung collapse.
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of right mainstem metastasis.
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Metastatic renal cell carcinoma to right mainstem bronchus causing central airway obstruction.

note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY – RIGID BRONCHOSCOPY WITH MECHANICAL DEBULKING

Patient: James Patel, 69-year-old male
MRN: S31640-005
Date: 2024-03-19
Location: Valley Regional Medical Center – OR
Attending: Dr. Melissa Wong

Indication:
Fixed stridor and exertional dyspnea from proximal tracheal mass thought to represent adenoid cystic carcinoma.

Procedure:
Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking and excision of proximal tracheal tumor (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia / Airway:
General anesthesia with rigid tracheoscope, jet ventilation. ASA class III.

Findings:
Smooth, submucosal-appearing tumor arising from posterior wall of the proximal trachea, approximately 3 cm below the vocal cords, protruding into the lumen and causing ~75% obstruction.

Interventions:
Tumor was grasped with rigid forceps and removed in several pieces. Additional mechanical debulking with the rigid bronchoscope bevel and forceps was used to shave down the residual lesion flush with the wall. A snare loop was used to perform final snare resection of a pedunculated component. No electrocautery, PDT, or cryotherapy was applied. Lumen diameter improved and air leak was unobstructed.

Hemostasis:
Minimal oozing controlled with cold saline. No significant bleeding.

EBL:
<10 mL.

Complications:
None.

Disposition and Plan:
Extubated in the OR and taken to PACU in stable condition. Pathology specimens sent for histology. Plan for definitive radiation once diagnosis confirmed.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Symptomatic proximal tracheal mass suspicious for adenoid cystic carcinoma.
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: CT neck with intraluminal proximal tracheal mass and airflow limitation.
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking and snare resection of proximal tracheal tumor.
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Suspected adenoid cystic carcinoma of proximal trachea (final pathology pending).

note_text:
BRONCHOSCOPY NOTE – MECHANICAL DEBULKING OF BRONCHUS INTERMEDIUS MASS

Patient: Evelyn Brooks, 54-year-old female
MRN: S31640-006
Date: 2024-04-07
Location: Coastal Lung Center – OR
Attending: Dr. Omar Rahman

Indication:
Central airway obstruction of the bronchus intermedius from endobronchial adenocarcinoma with recurrent post-obstructive pneumonia.

Procedure:
Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of bronchus intermedius tumor (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia:
General anesthesia; rigid coring with microdebrider. ASA class III.

Findings:
Friable, exophytic tumor arising from the bronchus intermedius, narrowing the lumen to ~85% with purulent secretions in the right lower lobe bronchi.

Interventions:
Secretions were suctioned and lavage performed. Rigid coring and mechanical debulking were then done using the rigid bronchoscope bevel. A microdebrider was advanced through the rigid scope to further debulk the tumor. Tumor was debulked in piecemeal fashion until the bronchus intermedius lumen was approximately 60–70% open with good visualization of RML and RLL takeoffs. No laser, APC, PDT, or cryotherapy performed.

Hemostasis:
Mild oozing at the tumor base, controlled with topical epinephrine and brief tamponade with the rigid scope.

EBL:
35 mL.

Complications:
None.

Disposition:
Extubated and transferred to the floor for overnight observation and IV antibiotics.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Bronchus intermedius obstruction from endobronchial adenocarcinoma with recurrent post-obstructive pneumonia.
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: CT chest with mass in bronchus intermedius and right lower lobe consolidation.
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of bronchus intermedius tumor.
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Endobronchial adenocarcinoma of the bronchus intermedius with post-obstructive pneumonia.

note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY PROCEDURE NOTE

Patient: Omar Hassan, 61-year-old male
MRN: S31640-007
Date: 2024-04-22
Institution: Summit Medical Center – Bronchoscopy Suite
Attending: Dr. Rachel Stone

Indication:
Worsening wheeze and recurrent collapse of left lower lobe from endobronchial carcinoid in the left lower lobe bronchus.

Procedure:
Flexible bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of endobronchial carcinoid tumor (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia / Sedation:
Moderate sedation with propofol infusion and fentanyl; LMA airway. ASA class II.

Findings:
Rounded, vascular, pedunculated mass originating from the origin of the left lower lobe bronchus, causing approximately 70% obstruction.

Intervention:
The tumor stalk was grasped with biopsy forceps and snare resection was performed at its base. Additional mechanical debulking with forceps removed residual tumor fragments until the lumen was largely free of tumor. No electrocautery, laser, or cryotherapy delivered. Mechanical excision and debulking of the obstructing carcinoid was clearly documented.

Hemostasis:
Brief oozing treated with cold saline; no significant bleeding.

EBL:
15 mL.

Complications:
None immediate.

Disposition:
Observed for 4 hours and then discharged home. Follow-up CT and surveillance bronchoscopy planned in 3 months.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Endobronchial carcinoid causing obstruction of the left lower lobe bronchus.
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: CT chest with left lower lobe endobronchial lesion and distal air trapping.
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Flexible bronchoscopy with snare resection and mechanical debulking of carcinoid.
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Endobronchial typical carcinoid tumor of the left lower lobe bronchus.

note_text:
RIGID BRONCHOSCOPY WITH MECHANICAL DEBULKING – OPERATIVE REPORT

Patient: Lin Chen, 49-year-old female
MRN: S31640-008
Date: 2024-05-10
Hospital: East Bay Medical Center – OR
Attending: Dr. Jonathan Miles

Indication:
Malignant central airway obstruction from left mainstem squamous cell carcinoma with acute hypoxic respiratory failure.

Procedure:
Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of left mainstem tumor (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia:
General anesthesia; rigid bronchoscope with jet ventilation. ASA class IV.

Findings:
Bulky, friable tumor filling the left mainstem lumen with 95% obstruction, copious mucus, and collapse of left lung. Right airway normal.

Interventions:
After suctioning secretions, rigid coring was performed repeatedly through the tumor using the rigid bronchoscope bevel. Large tumor chunks were removed with forceps. A microdebrider was used for fine mechanical debulking until the airway lumen was sufficiently re-opened. Tumor debulking and excision were entirely mechanical; no ablative energy (laser, RFA, PDT, or cryotherapy) was used.

Hemostasis:
Moderate oozing controlled with topical epinephrine and short periods of tamponade. No transfusion.

EBL:
60 mL.

Complications:
None aside from transient desaturation to 88% during initial rigid coring, improved with recruitment.

Disposition:
Remained intubated post-procedure and transported to ICU. Post-procedure chest radiograph showed re-expansion of the left lung.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Critical left mainstem obstruction from squamous cell carcinoma with acute respiratory failure.
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: Near-complete left lung collapse with obstructing left mainstem mass.
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Emergent rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of left mainstem tumor.
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Bulky endobronchial squamous cell carcinoma of the left mainstem.

per_code.summary: Kept. Supported by explicit description of mechanical excision (rigid coring, forceps, microdebrider) and absence of thermal ablation.

global_comments: Procedure involved purely mechanical debulking; CPT 31640 is appropriate.

note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY PROCEDURE NOTE – MECHANICAL DEBULKING

Patient: Jacob Morales, 76-year-old male
MRN: S31640-009
Date: 2024-05-28
Location: Central Veterans Hospital – OR
Attending: Dr. Helena Grant

Indication:
Hemoptysis and dyspnea due to right mainstem endobronchial squamous cell carcinoma.

Procedure:
Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of right mainstem tumor (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia:
General anesthesia; rigid bronchoscope with controlled ventilation. ASA class III.

Findings:
Ulcerated, friable tumor occupying ~70% of the right mainstem lumen with clot burden. Distal lobar branches visible but narrowed.

Interventions:
Clot and secretions suctioned. Rigid coring performed with the rigid scope to mechanically debulk the tumor. Forceps debulking removed residual fragments. A microdebrider was then used to further debulk and smooth the tumor base. Tumor debulked mechanically until lumen patency improved to ~60–70%. No ablative modalities applied.

Hemostasis:
Moderate oozing controlled with cold saline and dilute epinephrine.

EBL:
50 mL.

Disposition:
Extubated in the OR and transferred to step-down unit for observation overnight.

Plan:
Repeat bronchoscopy in 6–8 weeks or earlier if recurrent hemoptysis.

registry_entry.bronch_indication: Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of right mainstem tumor.
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Endobronchial squamous cell carcinoma of the right mainstem bronchus.

note_text:
BRONCHOSCOPY PROCEDURE NOTE

Patient: Priya Singh, 65-year-old female
MRN: S31640-010
Date: 2024-06-12
Institution: Midtown Academic Hospital – OR
Attending: Dr. Andrew Fields

Indication:
Left mainstem obstruction from metastatic breast cancer with progressive dyspnea and cough.

Procedure:
Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of metastatic tumor (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia:
General anesthesia; rigid bronchoscope, ASA class III.

Findings:
Irregular, nodular tumor on the lateral wall of the left mainstem bronchus, causing ~80% obstruction with distal atelectasis.

Interventions:
Mechanical debulking performed using the rigid bronchoscope bevel, followed by forceps debulking. Snare resection was used to remove a pedunculated portion of tumor. The procedure explicitly consisted of tumor excision and mechanical debulking without any thermal ablation. Final lumen patency approximated 60% with visible segmental orifices.

Hemostasis:
Controlled with cold saline; no significant bleeding.

EBL:
20 mL.

Complications:
None.

Disposition:
Extubated, monitored in PACU, then admitted to oncology floor.

registry_entry.radiographic_findings: CT chest showing left mainstem soft tissue lesion with distal volume loss.

registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Metastatic breast carcinoma to left mainstem bronchus with central airway obstruction.
